title: Bjarne Brustad
text:
Bjarne Brustad (4 March 1895, in <a href="Kristiania">Kristiania</a>, now Oslo – 20 May 1978, in <a href="Oslo">Oslo</a>) was a <a href="Norwegian%20people">Norwegian</a> <a href="composer">composer</a>, <a href="violin">violin</a>ist and <a href="Viola">violist</a>. He played with symphonic orchestras in Stavanger and Oslo. In the 1920s he travelled to European cities such as Paris, Munich and Berlin, where he received musical inspiration and contacts. From 1928 to 1943, Brustad was viola soloist with <a href="Oslo%20Philharmonic">Philharmonic Society Orchestra</a> in Oslo. He wrote <a href="symphony">symphonies</a>, compositions for violin and orchestra, <a href="chamber%20music">chamber music</a> and <a href="opera">opera</a>. His opera "Atlantis" was finished in 1945. After <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> he was also active in organizing work.
As a teacher at the <a href="Oslo%20Conservatory%20of%20Music">Oslo Conservatory of Music</a>, his students included <a href="Bj%C3%B8rn%20Fongaard">Bjørn Fongaard</a> and <a href="Trond%20%C3%98yen">Trond Øyen</a>.
